member.name: T:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IApplication
member.summary:
ONLY NECESSARY FOR USE WITH COM - NOT RECOMMENDED TO USE WITH .NET-API USE STATIC METHODS OF MICROLCMANAGER INSTEAD
This is the default interface of the Application class. It is used to visible all Methods inside the COM interface.

member.name: P:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IApplication.Manager
member.summary: Returns The Instance of a microLCManager -> Wrapper for: MicroLCManager.GetInstance()

member.name: M:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IApplication.InitializeManager(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Com-Wrapper Function for MicroLCManager.InitializeManager(includeMockups)
The MicroLCManager is a Singleton. He can only be created once per runtime. If the user wants to start with extra Configuration, He has to call this Methode before he calls getInstance. Attention: The MicroLC can only initialized once. Otherwise an exception is thrown.
member.param: should demos be integreated

member.name: M:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IApplication.InitializeManager(System.String)
member.summary:
COM-Wrapper Function for MicroLCManager.InitializeManager(Path)
The MicroLCManager is a Singleton. He can only be created once per runtime. If the user wants to start with extra Configuration, He has to call this Methode before he calls getInstance. Attention: The MicroLC can only initialized once. Otherwise an exception is thrown.
member.param: path to a MicroLC Software Project File

members.member:
Property to set the voltage and voltage mode (symmetrical, asymmetrical) of the camshaft .
Voltage mode: 0 for assymetrical mode, 1 for symmetrical mode ÂµLC Test System >= 3.2B: Example: SetVoltage(1, 8.4) Camshaft voltage Example for ÂµLC Test System 3.0, 3.1, 3.2A Sample: SetVoltage(0, 5) or SetVoltage(1, 12) Example for ÂµLC Test System >= 3.2B: SetVoltage(0, 5) or SetVoltage(1, 8.4)

If this Property is set to true, there is no need to call Change after a change, because all changes are applied to the frame in the moment they are made. If this Property is set to false, you have to call Change to make a change operative on the ÂµLC
This Property is standard set to true and has to be changed if needed otherwise

members.member:
The method can be called if only one byte of the frame's payload shall be set
position of payload byte value to set payload byte

member.name: T:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.CANFD.CanFDTxFrame
member.summary: This class represents a Message of CAN which is sent. With the functions and Propertys in this class the user is able to set the bytes and the Identifier of the Message. Also they're able to send a Message frequently.

member.summary: bool which indicates if this Frame is currently send frequently through setting it true or false, the TransmitMessageFrequently Method of Channel is called

member.summary:
If this Property is set to true, there is no need to call Change after a change, because all changes are applied to the frame in the moment they are made. If this Property is set to false, you have to call Change to make a change operative on the ÂµLC

member.summary: Default interface of FlexIO class, which specifies which methods are visible for COM

member.name: M:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IFlexIO.MapComponent(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Maps the available microLC Component to FlexIO pin, If the pin has already a microLC component, it gets replaced
member.param: FlexIO pin to which passed microLC component should be mapped
Represents the microLC component type, select the index from ComponentMode
member.return: channel index of the uLC component mapped to the pin, this index shall be used to get API object of the uLC component and perform further operations returns '-1' if the component is not mapped to any pin

member.name: M:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IFlexIO.RemoveComponent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes already assigned uLC component from the pin
member.param: FlexIO pin from which already assigned uLC component should be removed

member.summary: Returns the MicroLC component type mapped to the pin returns null if the component is not mapped to any pin
member.param: FlexIO pin whose mapped component type is needed

member.name: M:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IFlexIO.GetMappedComponentChannelIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the MicroLC component channel index mapped to the pin returns '-1' if the component is not mapped to any pin
member.param: FlexIO pin whose MicroLC component channel index is needed

member.name: T:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IManipChannel
member.summary: Default interface of Manipulation class, which specifies which methods are visible for COM

member.name: P:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IManipChannel.IsChannelActive
member.summary: Indicator, whether channel is activated or not.

member.name: P:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IManipChannel.PWMLevel
member.summary:
Represents PWM Output Level.
1 = 5V
2 = 12V

member.name: P:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IManipChannel.ChannelID
member.summary: The ID of the channel.

member.name: P:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IManipChannel.Sensor
member.summary:
The current sensor of the channel. This is only used if the channel is type SENT.
H1_Dual_12bit = 0
H2_Single_12bit = 1
H3_12bit_HighSpeed = 12
H4_Secure_12bit = 2
H5_12bit_Zero = 4
H6_14bit_10bit = 5
H7_16bit_8bit = 6

member.name: P:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IManipChannel.Input
member.summary:
Represents the configured input of the signal.
PWM AND SENT:
PWM_IN_1 = 0, PWM_IN_2 = 1
Analog:
ADC0 = 0, ADC1 = 1 ... ADC5 = 5

member.name: P:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IManipChannel.Output
member.summary:
Represents the configured output of the signal.
PWM AND SENT:
PWM_SENT_1 = 0, PWM_SENT_2 = 1, PWM_SENT_3 = 2, PWM_SENT_4 = 3
Analog:
DAC0 = 0, DAC1 = 1 ... DAC11 = 11.

member.name: P:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IManipChannel.Type
member.summary: Represents the type of the channel.

member.name: P:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IManipChannel.DataItems
member.summary:
List of all manipulation items of a channel.
SENT:
Item on Pos 0 = Manipulation value 1
Item on Pos 1 = Manipulation value 2,
PWM:
Item on Pos 0 = Manipulation frequency
Item on Pos 1 = duty cycle
Analog:
Item on Pos 0 = Manipulation amplitude

member.summary: Sets a Value by its signal name
member.param: name of the signal which should be set

value as double ([for dout: 0=Disabled, 1=Enabled, 2=Tristate] [for PWMorSentMode: 0=Off, 1=SimplePWM, 2=Complex, 3=Sent] [for Outputlevel: 0=Level_12V, 1=Level_5V, 2=Level_0V, 3=Level_OpenDrain, 4=Level_Z_5V, 5=Level_Z_12V, 6=Level_ShutDown, 99=Level_Unexpected] [for IdFormat: 0=STANDARD_ID 1=EXTENDED_ID] [for CrankshaftSensorType: 0=Hall, 1=Induktiv, 2=DG23i, 3=TL4953] [for SentSensorType: Throttle_Position = 0, Mass_Air_Flow_Typ_1 = 1, Mass_Air_Flow_Typ_2 = 2, Mass_Air_Flow_Typ_3 = 3, Single_Secure = 4, Single_Sensors_Typ_1 = 5, Single_Sensors_Typ_2 = 6, Pressure = 7, Pressure_Secure = 8 [for PWM_INResistorState: PULLUP = 0, PULLDOWN = 1, DISABLED = 2] [for MSG_TYPE: SHORT_8BIT = 0, ENHANCED_12BIT = 1, ENHANCED_16BIT = 2, UNDEFINED = 3] [for CYLINDERPRESSURE_GRAPH: COMBUSTION = 0, OVERRUN = 1]) [for ADC_Calibration_Mode: OffsetCalibration = 0, GainCalibration = 1, UserpageCurrentCalibration = 2, UserpageDefaultCalibration = 3, FactoryDefaultCalibration = 4, InternCalibration = 5]

member.summary: This Property is the maximal possible Value, which can be set to the DAC. Setting of this property is not possible.

member.summary: Returns the electrical value of the DAC component. If the Errormode is active the electrical Value can be set, too. Values lower and higher the maximum possible electrical value will be automaticly set to the lowest or highest possible value.

member.name: M:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.Device.FirmwareChangesUpdate
member.summary: Updates the firmware of the device If no update is avaiable, it will jump over. The reason will be logged in the log file. The expansionboard will only update, if the mainboard is up to date If the update fails, an exception will be thrown and the program will stop

member.summary: Updates the firmware of the device using the hexfile at the specified path. Be careful with this method. Using a bad hexfile can make the device non operational.
member.param: Path of the hexfile used for flashing, as string

member.summary: The Error level designates error events that might still allow the application to continue running.

member.name: F:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.LogLevel.Warn
member.summary: The Warn level designates potentially harmful situations.

member.name: F:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.LogLevel.Info
member.summary: The INFO level designates informational messages that highlight the progress of the application.

member.name: F:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.LogLevel.Debug
member.summary: The Debug level designates fine-grained informational events that are most useful to debug an application.

member.name: F:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.LogLevel.All
member.summary: The All level designates the lowest level possible.

member.name: M:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.MicroLCManager.InitializeManager(System.Boolean)
member.summary: The MicroLCManager is a Singleton. It can only be created once per runtime. If the user wants to start with extra Configuration, He has to call this Methode before he calls getInstance. Attention: The MicroLC can only be initialized once. Otherwise an exception is thrown. If there is a need to use another Configuration during the runtime ExitManager() can be called. After that the first Configuration is discarded and a new Configuration can be loaded with one of the InitializeManager-Methods.
member.param: should demos integreated

member.name: M:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.MicroLCManager.InitializeManager(System.String)
member.summary: The MicroLCManager is a Singleton. It can only be created once per runtime. If the user wants to start with extra Configuration, He has to call this Methode before he calls getInstance. Attention: The MicroLC can only be initialized once. Otherwise an exception is thrown. If there is a need to use another Configuration during the runtime ExitManager() can be called. After that the first Configuration is discarded and a new Configuration can be loaded with one of the InitializeManager-Methods.
member.param: path to a MicroLC Software Project File

member.name: M:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.MicroLCManager.InitializeManager(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: The MicroLCManager is a Singleton. It can only be created once per runtime. If the user wants to start with extra Configuration, He has to call this Methode before he calls getInstance. Attention: The MicroLC can only be initialized once. Otherwise an exception is thrown. If there is a need to use another Configuration during the runtime ExitManager() can be called. After that the first Configuration is discarded and A new Configuration can be loaded with one of the InitializeManager-Methods.
member.param: should demos integreated
path to a MicroLC Software Project File

member.name: M:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IRPM.ConfigOscillatingStop(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32[]})
member.summary: Configurates the pendulum steps for the oscillating stop.
member.param: List of int[3] values that represent each pendulum step.
member.remarks: The list given to this method needs to have specific characteristics and works the following way: It contains multiple int arrays which must have the length of 3 and the configuration of the int[] should look like this: [Angles in tenth of a degree (e.g. 1000 = 100Â°), rpm (e.g. 1000), direction (0 = forward, 1 = backward)]. Each int array represents one swing out step.

member.name: M:bosch.de.abt.beg.microLC.API.IRPM.SetHybridSensorHysteresis(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the RPM range values based on which sensor will act as a DG23i sensor or HALL sensor. If the RPM is between {@param dg23iRange} and {@param hallRange} then sensor will switch to DG23i sensor mode If the RPM is between {@param hallRange} and 'Maximum RPM' then sensor will switch to HALL range sensor mode The RPM value in which sensor should act in DG23i mode The RPM value in which sensor should act in Hall mode
